resources.string: Please close the current trip before logging out.
Are you sure you want to log out?
Are you sure you want to end trip?
Cannot get your location. Please enable GPS.
Are you sure you want to exit?
Thank you for closing your last month. The log has gone to your line manager for authorisation and the deduction will be calculated and reported back to you prior to being submitted to payroll.
Currently there is no jobs for you. Please tap below button to get newest job list from server.
Are you sure you want to remove photo?
The vehicle has been cleaned / valeted inside and out for the day of collection and ensure that the parcel shelf and accessories that the vehicle was supplied with is returned in full working order.
The Book Pack and Service Book returned in the vehicle(updated as per the manufacturers scheduled guidelines)
The MOT Certificate is available – (if applicable)
A full set of keys, including the master key, spares and locking wheel-nut keys, should be returned in working order if originally supplied.
Return vehicle with 1/4 tank of fuel
Door Mirrors – Missing, cracked or damaged mirrors are not acceptable. If adjustable and /or heated door mirrors, they must be in working order when returned

Windows / windscreens – light scratching is acceptable provided it does not interfere with the driver’s line of sight and any heating elements still work properly. Chips, cracks and holes are not acceptable. Repaired chips within the driver’s line of sight are not acceptable. Repaired chips outside the driver’s line of sight are acceptable provided they are repaired to a professional standard.
All lamps must work. Minor scuffs marks and scratches up to 25mm are acceptable. Holes or cracks in the glass or plastic covers of lamp are not acceptable.

All tyres, including any spare, must meet minimum UK legal requirements (in excess of 1.6mm tread across the entire width of the wheel) and comply with the vehicle manufacturer’s recommendations of tyre type, class*, size and speed rating for the vehicle. There must be no damage to sidewalls or tread. Evidence of uneven wear due to under or over inflation is not acceptable. Punctured or illegal tyres are not acceptable and will result in an aborted collection
Vehicle has no warning lights displayed. There is no unreported accident damage on the vehicle which will result in excess damage charges.
Any third party induced damage should be reported. Any own fault damage (including damage whilst parked), must be reported to Peter Dinallo immediately
